weekly_top_story.headline: Government shuts down, impacting healthcare provisions and telehealth flexibilities
weekly_top_story.summary: The federal government shutdown that began October 1, 2025, has led to the expiration of key healthcare provisions, including Medicare telehealth flexibilities, affecting access to care and provider operations.

stories.headline: Furloughed CMS employees are called back to manage Medicare and ACA enrollment
stories.summary: As the government shutdown continues, furloughed CMS staff are being recalled to ensure Medicare and ACA enrollment processes remain operational, highlighting the ongoing strain on federal healthcare administration.

stories.headline: AHA pushes CMS to delay Medicare prior authorization pilot
stories.summary: The American Hospital Association is urging CMS to delay its Medicare prior authorization pilot program, citing concerns about provider burden and the need for more preparation time.

stories.headline: Family job-based health insurance premiums hit an average of $27,000 in 2025
stories.summary: The average cost of family health insurance through employers has reached $27,000 in 2025, reflecting ongoing financial pressures on both employers and employees.
